title: "Project Templates"

These templates provide a consistent starting point for lab projects. Each includes:

- Pre-configured `_targets.R` pipeline
- Standard directory structure
- Example analysis code
- Configuration management
- Consistency validation framework

## Available Templates

::: {.template-card}
### Research Project

General-purpose template for data analysis projects.

<span class="badge badge-r">R</span>
<span class="badge badge-targets">targets</span>

**Best for:**

- Exploratory data analysis
- Statistical modeling
- One-off analyses

**Features:**

- Base R + data.table workflow
- Package dependencies documented
- Basic reporting with Quarto

[Learn More →](research-project.qmd) | [GitHub](https://github.com/rashid-lab/template-research-project)
:::

::: {.template-card}

Standards for creating reusable R packages separate from paper repositories.

<span class="badge badge-r">R</span>

## Quick Start

```bash
# 1. Clone the template
git clone git@github.com:rashid-lab/template-research-project.git my-project

# 2. Remove template history
cd my-project
rm -rf .git
git init

# 3. Install dependencies
# In R:
# Install packages listed in DESCRIPTION or README

# 4. Run the example
targets::tar_make()
```

## Common Files Across Templates

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `_targets.R` | Pipeline definition |
| `config/globals.yml` | Centralized configuration |
| `R/` | Reusable functions |
| `DESCRIPTION` | Package dependencies |
| `CLAUDE.md` | Project guidance |

## Consistency Framework

All templates include the [consistency validation framework](../project-consistency/index.qmd):

```bash
# Validate code-manuscript alignment
make validate-consistency

# Quick check during development
make validate-quick
```

## Customizing Templates

After cloning:

1. **Update `config/globals.yml`** with your parameters
2. **Modify `_targets.R`** to define your pipeline
3. **Add functions** to `R/` directory
4. **Update documentation** in `CLAUDE.md` and `README.md`

::: {.callout-tip}
## Keep Templates Updated
Periodically check the template repos for improvements. You can cherry-pick useful changes into your project.
:::
